techmeme.title: Zuckerberg says Meta is training Llama 4 models on a cluster of 100K+ H100 chips, "or bigger than anything that I've seen reported for what others are doing" (Wired)
South Korean government data: semiconductor production fell 3% YoY in September 2024, the first decline in 14 months, indicating slowing demand for memory chips (Sam Kim/Bloomberg)
Mark Zuckerberg says Meta is "executing quite well" in building out AI infrastructure, as Meta raises the low end of its 2024 capex guidance to $38B from $37B (Jonathan Vanian/CNBC)
Source: Amazon's target deadline to unveil AI-upgraded Alexa has moved into 2025, after documents showed Amazon planned to unveil the product on Oct. 17, 2024 (Bloomberg)
Microsoft says its AI business is on track to surpass an annual revenue run rate of $10B in Q2, its fastest product category ever to reach that milestone (Ina Fried/Axios)
